nefra.db

Class DBFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • nefra.db.DBFunctions
  • Deprecated. 
    See SysCreator and SysLoader

    @Deprecated
public class DBFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to hold all functions for accessing, updating, removing and inserting into the database.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Cordel Murphy

      • DBFunctions

        public DBFunctions()
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a connection from the database and sets an initial statement. If required the database is also set up using instantiateDatabase.

    • Method Detail

      • instantiateDatabase

        @Deprecated
private boolean instantiateDatabase(java.sql.Statement statement)
        Deprecated. See SysCreator.Setup()
        If required it sets up the database by creating the tables and constraints.
        Parameters:
        statement - Passes the connection into the function so it can continue to use the existing one.
        Returns:
        If the instantiation is successful or not.
        Since:
        1.0

      • loadDatabase

        @Deprecated
public boolean loadDatabase()
        Deprecated. See SysLoader.getInstance()
        Load the database into memory so it can be used in the GUI. This also sets to foreign keys to what they should be (Clubs, Division, Referees).
        Returns:
        If the loading of the database is successful or not.
        Since:
        1.0

      • insertReferee

        @Deprecated
public boolean insertReferee(Referee referee)
        Deprecated. See SysCreator.Referee(Referee, boolean)
        Inserts a referee into the database using the data given from the GUI when entered. After successfully inserting into the database, it gets the id from the database (auto increment column) and sets it to the object in memory.
        Parameters:
        referee - The Referee object to be entered into the database using the information from the created object.
        Returns:
        If the insertion is successful or not.
        Since:
        1.0
